Package testing

Class ChessModelTests

java.lang.Object
testing.ChessModelTests
public class ChessModelTests extends Object
This class provides testing for all the non-gui non networked elements of the code base. The goal of the tests is to provide insight and hopefully find areas of the program where the code could fell and give more confidence in the established code base.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    ChessModelTests()
     

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    testCapturePiece()
    This method tests the capture of pieces using the compare assert and the play method
    void
    testCastle()
    This method tests the castle operation in the model vs the expected board state at the end of the given moves
    void
    testCheckmate()
    This method tests the checkmate functionality
    void
    testControllerTurn()
    This method tests a variety of different turn logic in the controller and model by swapping turns and manually changing the turn state
    void
    testInvalidMoveIntoCheckMoveMessage()
    This method checks first that the player cannot make a move if the move puts the player in check and secondly it tests the functionality of the ChessMoveMessage by representing the moves as ChessMoveMessages
    void
    testMoveMessage()
    This method tests the functionality of the ChessMoveMessage by creating a basic move and testing the moveSet from the move message
    void
    testMoveSet()
    This method tests the piece move set functionality specifically for the queen
    void
    testNetworkedMove()
    This method tests the networked move functionality
    void
    testPieceMadeFirstMove()
    This method tests the getFirstMove functionality for each piece
    void
    testPromotePawn()
    This method tests pawn promotion using the play method and compare assert
    void
    testSaveGame()
    This method tests the save game functionality against the given game string
    void
    testSaveLoadGame()
    This method tests the ability to save and load a game
